fields.headline: Good day, bad day
fields.bodyText: Defector of the day Not Tory turncoat Shaun Woodward, but Geri Halliwell. She once described Margaret Thatcher as an inspiration, but tonight the ex-Spice will be the star of Labour's first election broadcast Good day Ali G (Staines West), who topped a Radio 1 poll of first- time voters asked who the next prime minister should be. He polled 24% of votes among 18- to 22-year-olds, slightly more than the 18% who said they could be bothered to vote Bad day Margaret Beckett The leader of the house managed to remember just three of Labour's five pledge-card commitments when interviewed on Sky, overpledged the police by 4,000 and just plain forgot the fifth Bad air day Charlie Kennedy damaged his environmental credentials by touring nine cities by private jet. "The party with the biggest green pretensions has chosen the most environmentally damaging mode of transport." Quote of the day Michael Ancram, after watching Tony Blair's speech: "It will be hard to rebut. There's nothing there to rebut. I'm surprised he wasn't wearing a dog collar" Poll of Polls Constance Poll, 69, from Powick, Worcester: "I shall vote Conservative. I wouldn't give Blair the time of day. I've never been Labour, although I did give them a chance the last time - but they've caused chaos since then. I haven't got a lot of good to say about Hague, either, but luckily he's not going to be around for ever"
